info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Catawba, eastern Alexander and northern Iredell Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Taylorsville, or 4 miles north of Stony Point, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylorsville, Stony Point, Love Valley, Lookout Shoals Lake, Hiddenite, Scotts, Millersville and Oxford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
